lines.text: [last lines]
Thank you, Clearlake! C'mon... we love you, we'll see you next year.
[first lines]
Hey, Riley, we're all plugged in and checked up... yeah, we're ready.

[to Ray Bob]
Riley wants to hear you at the mike - that's the one right there; say somethin' into that mike.
One, two, three, testing... one...

[to Riley]
How's that sound?
All right, that's a good level, Buddy, hold it right there... Yeah, you better get ready, it's about thirty seconds till eight.
Boo!
Oh you scared me half to death!
Where're ya goin?
I'm working
Have you been getting anything special in the mail lately?
Yes and I don't mean to be rude Buddy but I just don't want to encourage you.
Why not?
There's no point going into it, just take my word. I think you're very sweet and thank you for the roses but now you're about to ask me out and I...

Wait, just wait a minute, just wait a minute, let me explain one thing to you. I have never, ever chased after a girl before in my life and it feels funny to me. Now if you're not gonna go out with me I wanna know why. You do like me don't you?
Yeah, I'm fond of you.
Well then what's the hold up?
My aunt.
Your aunt? Mrs Santiago in the publishing department? She doesn't even know me!
It doesn't matter. You are a musician. And under no circumstances am I allowed to go out with a musician. I'm sorry.
Well let me go talk to her.
It won't do any good. That's not her only objection and you know it.
Well what is the other objection?
I'm Puerto Rican. And you're, you're not.
So I'll change my name to Chihuahua
My aunt is very concious of these things.

Are you kidding me with this stuff about your aunt? You're not kidding? Maria I just went through this, with people who said a white act couldn't play with a coloured tour, we got along fine, we're still get along. I don't even know where Puerto Rico is. I've gotta go back there, we'll finish this later ok?
What do you want to do, Buddy?
Do you like that? Wait 'til you hear this one. Let's do Ollie Vee.
I don't think we'd better, Buddy.
It's for the boppers...
Hey, Ollie Vee.
Buddy, I don't think we'd better!
A.

[to the crowd]
We'd like to do this one for the boppers. For those of you who BOP!
Te quiero.
Eh?
Did you hear me?
No.
I said 'Te quiero'.
Te quiero?
Porque tu tienes la maneras del amor verdadero.
What does that mean?
I said, 'I love you because you have true love ways.'
True love ways... That's really pretty

[after playing a song for a crowd]
Whoo! Gave my heartbeat a little skip, y'all.
